avdta.network.link

Class Link

  • java.lang.Object
    • avdta.network.link.Link
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Link>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CentroidConnector, CTMLink, LTMLink

    public abstract class Link
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Link>
    An abstract DTA link. The flow model is not specified, but defines universal properties.
    LTM stands for Link Transmission Model.
    CTM for Cell Transmission Model.
    PQ for Point-Queue Model.
    CENTROID is for links which originate from centroid connectors.
    numLanes is for the number of lanes on the link.
    ffspd is for the free flow speed.
    wavespd is for the wave speed.
    jamd is the jam density.
    avgTT[] is the average running time of all vehicles over an assignment interval.
    avgToll[] is the average toll.
    R and S are the receiving flow and the sending flow respectively.
    q and Q are the flow and the capacity respectively.
    lanes_blocked lanes blocked for intersection queuing in Tile-Based Reservation.
    arr_time is the arrival time to the end of the link while trying to find time dependent shortest path.
    prev previous Link for shortest path related things.
    grade denotes the elevation of the link.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Link

        public Link(int id,
            Node source,
            Node dest,
            double capacity,
            double ffspd,
            double wavespd,
            double jamd,
            double length,
            int numLanes)
        Constructs the link with the given parameters
        Parameters:
        id - the link id
        source - the source node
        dest - the destination node
        capacity - the capacity per lane (veh/hr)
        ffspd - the free flow speed (mi/hr)
        wavespd - the congested wave speed (mi/hr)
        jamd - the jam density (veh/mi)
        length - the length (mi)
        numLanes - the number of lanes

      • canUseLink

        public boolean canUseLink(DriverType driver)
        Returns whether the given DriverType can use this Link. It depends on the downstream intersection control; human vehicles cannot use reservations unless the parameter is set.
        Parameters:
        driver - the DriverType specifying human or autonomous
        Returns:
        whether the driver can use this Link
